title: PBS NewsHour: Climate Change Impact on Global Economy

transcript.text: Good evening, I'm Judy Woodruff with the PBS NewsHour.
Tonight, we examine how climate change is reshaping the global economy with Dr. Sarah Chen from MIT.
Dr. Chen, your recent research shows significant economic impacts from rising sea levels.
That's right, Judy. Our analysis of coastal cities shows potential GDP losses of up to 15% by 2050.

summary: PBS NewsHour examines the economic impacts of climate change, featuring an interview with Dr. Sarah Chen from MIT discussing research on coastal city vulnerabilities and GDP projections.
key_points: Climate change is significantly impacting the global economy
Coastal cities face potential GDP losses of up to 15% by 2050
MIT research provides new insights into economic vulnerabilities
Rising sea levels are a major economic concern

entities.label: CONCEPT
entities.context: Long-term shifts in global climate patterns

relationships.context: Judy Woodruff is the host of PBS NewsHour
Dr. Sarah Chen conducts research at MIT
Climate change impacts GDP through economic losses
